did.unittitle: Steve Early Communications Workers of America Research Files
did.abstract: Steve Early has been an organizer, strike strategist, labor educator, and lawyer, and a national staff member of the Communications Workers of America. He is the author of Embedded With Organized Labor (2009) and his articles, reviews, and op-ed pieces have appeared in labor, progressive and mainstream periodicals and newspapers. This collection documents the struggles of the Communications Workers of America in New York and New England with the NYNEX telephone company, and includes contract campaigns, strike, and organizing materials from New York and New England. Included are meeting notes, memos, newsletters, circulars, fliers, clippings, injunction-related legal materials, and several posters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains files collected, and in some instnances created by Steve Early in his roles as a Communications Workers of America official and as a writer on labor topics, The collection documents the struggles of the CWA in New York and New England with the NYNEX telephone company and other major telecommunications employers, such as Verizon and the Southern New England Telephone Company, including contract negotions and strikes. Included are materials from New York and New England CWA locals and CWA District 1, which covers the combined area. Among the materials are meeeting agendas and notes, internal union memos, strike strategy memos and training materials, injunction-related lagal papers, flyersm clippings, circulars and other printed ephemera, and several oversized posters.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Steve Early has been an organizer, strike strategist, labor educator, lawyer, and a national staff member of the Communications Workers of America (CWA). CWA-represented telephone workers in the Northeast participated in national, regional or statewide strikes in 1983, 1986, 1989, 1998, 2000, 2004, and 2011. Druing these struggles the CWA cooperated with the International Brotherhood of Electriccal Workers, which also represented some telecommunications workers. As many as 60,000 workers in New York and New England were involved in the anti-concession strikes during this period at NYNEX and other major telecommuniccations employers. The four month NYNEX strike in 1989 defeated health care cost shifting. The CWA also struggled against employers' give-back demands, including the demand for forced overtime, and struggled to defended defined benefit pensions and retiree health coverage. The CWA aalso fought for card check unionization, and for employer neutrality during organizing campaigns, especially at Verizon Wireless, the company's fast-growing and almost entirely non-union cellular subsidiary.

As a CWA representative in this region and telecommunications industry strike coordinator, Early was involved in local contract negotiations, helping to publicize strike issues, organize mass rallies and marches, pressure company and public officials for favorable settlements, and generate grassroots community-labor support. Early is also the author of Embedded With Organized Labor (2009) and his articles, reviews, and op-ed pieces have appeared in labor, progressive and mainstream periodicals and newspapers.
